markdown:
'''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [quest](/pillarsOfEternityIiDeadfireQuests/) in {{poe2}}. ## Synopsis In this phase of the main quest, you need to ally yourself with one of the four [factions](/factions/) in order to be able to reach [Eothas](/eothas/) at [Ukaizo](/ukaizo/). The quest concludes after you finish the final faction quest of your chosen ally. If you don't wish to ally with a faction (or manage to antagonize all four factions), you can try to reach Ukaizo on your own. ## Walkthrough Completing this quest requires you to follow one of the options below, in which you will decide who gets [Ukaizo](/ukaizo/). The quests are mutually exclusive and when you talk to the faction leaders you will be asked to commit to their quest. In certain cases you can back away if you have good reputation with them, otherwise they may turn hostile. If you choose one of the "go it alone" options, no faction will control Ukaizo. ###### Options #[Taking Out the Traders](/takingOutTheTraders/) ([Huana](/huana/)): Return Ukaizo to the Huana and start a war between the trading companies. To achieve this, the Queen wants you to blow up the powder store at the [Brass Citadel](/brassCitadel/) and pin the blame on the Vailian Trading Company. # [The Final Maneuver](/theFinalManeuver/) ([Royal Deadfire Company](/royalDeadfireCompany/)): Hazanui Karū is ready to seize control of the archipelago by assassinating the Queen. # [A Vote of No Confidence](/aVoteOfNoConfidence/) and [Sabotage at the Brass Citadel](/sabotageAtTheBrassCitadel/) ([Vailian Trading Company](/vailianTradingCompany/)): The VTC plans to eliminate Rauatai from the archipelago... right after the matter of directorship is decided. # [Honor Among Thieves](/honorAmongThieves/) and [A Dance with Death](/aDanceWithDeath/) ([Príncipi sen Patrena](/principiSenPatrena/)): First, the matters of leadership need to be attended to, then you can reach Ukaizo with the [Floating Hangman](/floatingHangman/). # Go it alone (prepare your ship): If you choose to go at it alone, you will need the [Dragonwing Sails](/shipUpgradesSails/) and the [Blackwood Hull](/shipUpgradesHull/). Otherwise, the storm of Ondra's Mortar will sink your ship. # Go it alone (take the Floating Hangman): Yet another option is to complete A Dance with Death up to the point of obtaining the undead galleon, and then proceed to Ukaizo without reporting back to the Principi leader at Dunnage. Since you do not ally with the Principi unless you report back to Dunnage with the undead galleon, this method will allow you to travel to Ukaizo without allying with any of the factions. ## =Gods meeting = The gods will elect to meet you when you set sail again. They will be having an argument, particularly between [Woedica](/woedica/) and [Magran](/magran/). The argument covers the steps the gods should take against Eothas, including the option of possessing their godlike children or killing them to empower themselves. Then they will task the Watcher with entering Ukaizo - and warn against the [Guardian of Ukaizo](/guardianOfUkaizo/) left behind by [Engwith](/engwith/), their progenitors. Then you're dismissed after they ask for your opinion. ## Strongest rival The faction you help the most and don't align with is identified as your '''strongest rival'''. This faction will confront you at Ukaizo after completing '''The Coming Storm''' and will be factored into the end-game slides. If you sail to Ukaizo alone, the strongest faction will confront you, instead.[Talk:The_Coming_Storm](/talkTheComingStorm/) The strongest rival is determined by completing these quests or taking these actions: {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Change ! Faction ! Quest ! Conditions |- | +1 | RDC | [The Storms of Poko Kohara](/theStormsOfPokoKohara/) | Destroy the luminous adra pillar |- | +1 | VTC | [The Storms of Poko Kohara](/theStormsOfPokoKohara/) | Restore or destroy the luminous adra pillar |- | +1 | Príncipi | [A Dance with Death](/aDanceWithDeath/) | Complete quest |- | -2 | RDC | [Taking Out the Traders](/takingOutTheTraders/)
[Sabotage at the Brass Citadel](/sabotageAtTheBrassCitadel/) | Blow up the powderhouse |- | -2 | VTC | [Taking Out the Traders](/takingOutTheTraders/)
[Sabotage at the Brass Citadel](/sabotageAtTheBrassCitadel/) | Blow up the powderhouse, then blame the VTC |- | +1 | VTC | [Taking Out the Traders](/takingOutTheTraders/)
[Sabotage at the Brass Citadel](/sabotageAtTheBrassCitadel/) | Blow up the powderhouse, then deflect suspicion off the VTC |- | +1 | VTC | [Sabotage at the Brass Citadel](/sabotageAtTheBrassCitadel/) | Blamed VTC with Castol as head, Alvari replaces Castol as director |- | +1 | Huana | [Taking Out the Traders](/takingOutTheTraders/) | Accept the quest |- | +1 | Huana | [Taking Out the Traders](/takingOutTheTraders/) | Complete quest |- | +1 | Huana | [Fruitful Alliance](/fruitfulAlliance/) | Get the Wahaki to agree to the Queen's wishes |- | +1 | Príncipi | [A Shrewd Proposition](/aShrewdProposition/) | Complete quest (either Furrante's or Aeldys' way) |- | +1 | VTC | [Of Like Minds](/ofLikeMinds/) | Complete quest |- | +1 | VTC | [Of Like Minds](/ofLikeMinds/) | Side with the slavers |- | +2 | RDC | [Clearing Out Crookspur](/clearingOutCrookspur/) | Complete quest |- | +1 | Huana | [The Last Sanctuary](/theLastSanctuary/) | Complete quest |- | +1 | Huana | [The Shadow Under Neketaka](/theShadowUnderNeketaka/) | Strengthen the wards or capture part of the dragon's essence |- | -1 | Huana | [The Shadow Under Neketaka](/theShadowUnderNeketaka/) | Kill the dragon or let it free without capturing some essence |- | +1 | Príncipi | [Goods and Services](/goodsAndServices/) | Complete quest |- | +1 | Príncipi | [Symbols of Death](/symbolsOfDeath/) | Complete quest |- | +1 | Huana | [Trade Secrets](/tradeSecrets/) | Complete quest |- | +1 | Príncipi | [Blow the Man Down](/blowTheManDown/) | Complete quest, sparing Benweth |- | +1 | VTC | [Dirty Laundry](/dirtyLaundry/) | Complete quest |- | +1 | VTC | [Skipping Ahead](/skippingAhead/) | Complete quest, return to Castol |- | +1 | VTC | [A Vote of No Confidence](/aVoteOfNoConfidence/) | Maintain Castol as VTC director |- | +1 | RDC | [A Matter of Import](/aMatterOfImport/) | Successfully get [Iverra](/iverra/) to Sayuka |- | +1 | RDC | [A Matter of Import](/aMatterOfImport/) | Complete quest |- | +2 | RDC | [Overgrowth](/overgrowth/) | Go against Galawain's wishes and disable the machine |- | +1 | Príncipi | [Bounty - Chornu](/bountyChornu/)
[Bounty - Kuaro](/bountyKuaro/)
[Bounty - Rock-Stomper Rodul](/bountyRockStomperRodul/) | Complete all Príncipi bounties for [Udita](/udita/) |- | +1 | RDC | [Bounty - Assila Wave-Skipper](/bountyAssilaWaveSkipper/)
[Bounty - Radulf](/bountyRadulf/)
[Bounty - Burunga](/bountyBurunga/) | Complete all RDC bounties for [Fleet Master Wakoyo](/fleetMasterWakoyo/) |- | +1 | VTC | [Bounty - Biakara](/bountyBiakara/)
[Bounty - Veen](/bountyVeen/)
[Bounty - Desiwa the Shark](/bountyDesiwaTheShark/) | Complete all VTC bounties for [Aenia](/aenia/) |- | +1 | Huana | [Bounty - Diccila](/bountyDiccila/)
[Bounty - Oheiro](/bountyOheiro/)
[Bounty - Rafiq the Red Beard](/bountyRafiqTheRedBeard/) | Complete all Huana bounties for [Barati](/barati/) |- | -2 | VTC | | Kill [Ignato Castol](/ignatoCastol/) |- | -2 | VTC | | Kill [Lueva Alvari](/luevaAlvari/) (only counts if she's director) |- | -1 | Huana | | Kill [Prince Aruihi](/princeAruihi/) |- | -1 | Huana | | Kill [Queen Onekaza II](/queenOnekazaIi/) |- | -2 | Príncipi | | Kill [Captain Aeldys](/captainAeldys/) (only counts if she's leader) |- | -2 | Príncipi | | Kill [Captain Furrante](/captainFurrante/) |- | -1 | RDC | | Kill [Hazanui Karū](/hazanuiKaru/) |- | -1 | RDC | | Kill [Atsura](/atsura/) |- | -1 | RDC | | Kill [Fleet Master Okaya](/fleetMasterOkaya/) |- | -1 | RDC | | Kill [Fleet Master Wakoyo](/fleetMasterWakoyo/) |- |} ## Journal {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" style="word-break:break-all" | Quests/Crit_Path/CP_QST_Ukaizo_Preparations.quest |- ! width="40px" | {{tooltip|ID|Objectives: 0, Descriptions: 10000, Addenda: 20000, End states: 30000, Alternate descriptions: 40000}} ! colspan="2" | Objectives |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''0''' | colspan="2" | '''The Coming Storm''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10000 | Eothas has crossed beyond Magran's Teeth and into Ondra's Mortar. He makes for the lost island of Ukaizo. Only a capable ship could survive the journey through Ondra's Mortar. One of the great powers vying for dominance over the Deadfire might assist in this goal. If all else fails, outfitting the ship independently would be better preparation than none at all. |- | rowspan="19" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''1''' | colspan="2" | '''Forge alliances or prepare your ship for a hard voyage.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10001 | No doubt the local powers will want to put me to work in support of their cause to reach Ukaizo. Committing to any of them is sure to anger the others in the end. I could also go it alone, but [Player Ship] won't survive the journey without significant upgrades - I'd need the very best hull and sails available in the Deadfire. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20000 | I've made an enemy of the Huana royal family. Allying myself with them is no longer an option. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20010 | The Vailian Trading Company is not willing to work with me. Our respective priorities are too far at odds. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20011 | After everything I've done to harm them, working with the Royal Deadfire Company is no longer an option. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20012 | The Príncipi are unwilling to collaborate with me on the journey to Ukaizo. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20001 | Queen Onekaza has expressed an interest in joining forces. Working for her would mean giving Ukaizo back to the Huana. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20015 | If I ally with the Huana, I can expect watershapers to accompany my ship on the journey to Ukaizo. Their combined power should be enough to open a path through the storms. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20002 | Onekaza has asked me to blow up Rauatai's powderhouse and implicate the Vailians. This would solidify my union with the Huana once and for all. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20003 | I can find the Vailian Trading Company headquarters in Queen's Berth. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20004 | The headquarters of the Huana are at the Kahanga Palace in Serpent's Crown. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20005 | The Royal Deadfire Company's headquarters are at Imperial Command in the Brass Citadel. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20006 | The Príncipi sen Patrena organize their forces at Balefire Beacon on the island of Dunnage. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20007 | I've agreed to help Hazanui Karū and the Royal Deadfire Company overthrow the Huana and seize control of Neketaka. In exchange, they'll help me reach Ukaizo. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20008 | If I help the Príncipi deal with Lucia Rivan and acquire her ship, the Floating Hangman, they'll formalize an alliance with me and help me reach Ukaizo. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20009 | The Vailian Trading Company wants me to destroy the Royal Deadfire Company's powderhouse in the Brass Citadel. If I do this for them, they'll ally with me and help me reach Ukaizo. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20016 | I've found a Blackwood Log. It may allow me to craft a hull that can travel through Ondra's Mortar. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20013 | I've acquired the Blackwood Hull. While it won't make my ship indestructible, its strength will help me survive the storms around Ondra's Mortar. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20014 | I've acquired the Dragonwing Sails. Their unmatched toughness will withstand the fierce winds of Ondra's Mortar better than any other in the Deadfire. |- ! colspan="3" | End states |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30000 | [Player Ship] will travel with the aid of the Kahanga throne. The Huana are my allies now. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30001 | With the support of the Vailian Trading Company, [Player Ship] will soon be outfitted with the means to reach Ukaizo. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30002 | I have allied with the Royal Deadfire Company. The desire to reach Ukaizo is a mutual one. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30003 | The Príncipi sen Patrena have agreed to assist my voyage to Ukaizo. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30004 | I made it to Ukaizo without the aid of the Deadfire's competing powers. |}

Since you do not ally with the Principi unless you report back to Dunnage with the undead galleon, this method will allow you to travel to Ukaizo without allying with any of the factions. ===Gods meeting=== The gods will elect to meet you when you set sail again. Then they will task the Watcher with entering Ukaizo - and warn against the [[Guardian of Ukaizo]] left behind by [[Engwith]], their progenitors. Then you're dismissed after they ask for your opinion. ==Strongest rival== The faction you help the most and don't align with is identified as your '''strongest rival'''. This faction will confront you at Ukaizo after completing '''The Coming Storm''' and will be factored into the end-game slides. title: The Coming Storm
